stories.title: Initialize Worth App Foundation
stories.description: Set up the Next.js 16 project with TypeScript, Tailwind v4, shadcn/ui, and SQLite database using `bunx create-next-app@latest app --ts --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-bun --yes`, then set up Biome with `cd app && bun add -d @biomejs/biome && bunx @biomejs/biome init`. Establish the minimal, Apple-like design system with dynamic typography and automatic light/dark mode support.
acceptance: Next.js 16 app initialized with TypeScript and Bun using `bunx create-next-app@latest app --ts --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-bun --yes`
Biome configured for linting and formatting using `bun add -d @biomejs/biome && bunx @biomejs/biome init` (ESLint removed)
Tailwind v4 configured with CSS-first approach
shadcn/ui installed with `bunx shadcn@latest init` and borderless, minimal theme customization
SQLite database initialized with better-sqlite3 and Drizzle ORM
Database schema created for assets, debts, snapshots, and categories tables
Global CSS establishes typographic scale using clamp() for fluid sizing (e.g., clamp(1.5rem, 5vw, 3rem))
Automatic light/dark mode via prefers-color-scheme media query
Base layout is mobile-first with safe-area-inset padding for notched devices
Inter or SF Pro-like system font stack configured with whimsical weight variations

stories.title: Asset Management
stories.description: Users can add, edit, and delete assets with swipe gestures. Assets have a name, value, and optional category. The interface uses large typographic values and minimal chrome.
acceptance: Asset list displays with large monetary values as the visual anchor (using 10vh+ sizing)
Tap anywhere on an asset row opens inline edit mode with auto-focused input
Swipe left on asset reveals delete action with haptic-style visual feedback
Add asset via floating + button that expands into a minimal form
Form includes: name (text), value (currency input with formatting), category (optional select)
Currency input auto-formats with commas and handles decimal entry naturally
Empty state shows encouraging typography: 'Add your first asset'
All changes persist immediately to SQLite via API routes
Assets sorted by value descending by default

stories.title: Debt Management
stories.description: Users can add, edit, and delete debts with the same swipe-friendly interface as assets. Debts display with distinct visual treatment to differentiate from assets.
acceptance: Debt list mirrors asset list UX patterns for consistency
Debts display with subtle visual differentiation (muted color or minus prefix)
Swipe left reveals delete, swipe right could reveal 'paid off' quick action
Add debt form includes: name, balance, category, optional interest rate field
Debts sorted by balance descending by default
Empty state: 'No debts? Nice.'
All CRUD operations persist to SQLite via API routes
Interest rate stored but displayed subtly (not calculated, just informational)

stories.title: Net Worth Calculation & Display
stories.description: The hero of the app: a giant, beautiful net worth number that updates in real-time as assets and debts change. This is the first thing users see.
acceptance: Net worth displayed as hero element using dramatic typography (clamp(3rem, 15vw, 8rem))
Calculation: sum of all asset values minus sum of all debt balances
Positive values display in default text color, negative in a subtle warning tone
Number animates smoothly when values change (count-up/down effect)
Below the number: subtle breakdown showing 'Assets: $X Â· Debts: $Y'
Pull-to-refresh gesture recalculates from database
Home screen shows net worth prominently with assets/debts accessible via tab or swipe navigation
Net worth updates optimistically in UI before API confirms persistence

stories.title: Monthly Snapshot Capture
stories.description: Automatically or manually capture monthly snapshots of net worth to enable historical tracking. Snapshots are immutable records of a point in time.
acceptance: Manual 'Take Snapshot' action available (minimal button, not prominent)
Snapshot stores: date, total assets, total debts, net worth, and individual item values as JSON
Snapshots are immutable once created (no edit, only delete)
Auto-snapshot triggers on first app open of each month if no snapshot exists for that month
Snapshot list view shows month/year with net worth value
Tapping a snapshot shows detailed breakdown of what was captured
Delete snapshot via swipe gesture with confirmation
Snapshots stored in dedicated SQLite table with foreign key relationships

stories.title: Net Worth Trend Visualization
stories.description: A beautiful, minimal line chart showing net worth over time based on monthly snapshots. The chart is swipe-navigable and uses the app's typographic-first design language.
acceptance: Line chart displays net worth trend from all available snapshots
Chart uses minimal styling: thin line, no gridlines, subtle axis labels
Y-axis shows currency values with smart abbreviations ($10K, $1.2M)
X-axis shows months, scrollable horizontally if more than 6 months of data
Tap on any point shows tooltip with exact value and date
Chart handles negative net worth gracefully (line goes below zero line)
Empty state (< 2 snapshots): 'Keep tracking to see your trend'
Chart renders with lightweight library (e.g., recharts or custom SVG)
Smooth animations on data load and point selection

stories.title: Category-Based Breakdown
stories.description: See assets and debts grouped by category with visual proportions. Default categories provided, custom categories supported.
acceptance: Default categories seeded: Cash, Investments, Property, Vehicles, Other (assets); Credit Cards, Loans, Mortgage, Other (debts)
Users can create custom categories inline when adding/editing items
Breakdown view shows horizontal bar or donut visualization of category proportions
Tap on category filters the list to show only items in that category
Categories can be renamed or deleted (items reassign to 'Other')
Color coding is subtle and accessible (works in both light/dark modes)
Percentages shown alongside absolute values
Uncategorized items grouped under 'Other' automatically

stories.title: Data Export & Portability
stories.description: Users can export their complete financial data as JSON or CSV for backup or use in other tools. No lock-in.
acceptance: Export button in settings/menu area (not prominent, but discoverable)
Export formats: JSON (complete data structure) and CSV (flattened for spreadsheets)
JSON export includes: assets, debts, categories, snapshots with all metadata
CSV export creates separate sheets/files for assets, debts, snapshots
Export triggers native share sheet on mobile for saving/sending
Export filename includes date: worth-export-2024-01-15.json
No import feature in v1 (export only for simplicity)
Export completes quickly with subtle success feedback
